newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia, Croatia agree to expand economic ties.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia, Croatia agree to expand economic ties.

text.p: Croatian Prime Minister Zlatko Matesa and Indonesia's President Suharto agreed on Thursday to expand economic relations, Indonesian officials said.
"Both sides have agreed not only to expand economic relations but also other fields such as training for human resources development," State Secretary Murdiono told reporters.
Murdiono said Croatia agreed in principle to buy coal from Indonesia and cooperate in the oil and gas sectors.
"The president (Suharto) in principle has agreed to Croatia's intention to buy coal from Indonesia. It will be done through a counter trade," Murdiono said.
Murdiono said Indonesia had also agreed to grant arrival visas for Croatians visiting Indonesia.

Matesa's schedule includes a visit to the factory of state-owned aicraft maker PT Industri Pesawat Terbang Nusantara (IPTN) and the resort island of Bali on Friday. He will fly to Kuala Lumpur on Sunday from Bali.
Indonesia opened diplomatic relations with Croatia in 1992.
